content.question: In the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane, the point <math alttext="with coordinates 0 comma 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is on the curve <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, the negative of the fraction 4 x over 3 y, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for the curve, which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: At the point <math alttext="with coordinates 0 comma 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the curve <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a relative minimum because <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

At the point <math alttext="with coordinates 0 comma 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the curve <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a relative minimum because <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

At the point <math alttext="with coordinates 0 comma 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the curve <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a relative maximum because <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

At the point <math alttext="with coordinates 0 comma 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the curve <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></math> has a relative maximum because <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: At the point <math alttext="with coordinates 0 comma 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, the curve <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></math> has a relative maximum because <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
